alert.note: Alert for Fayette Ridges; Westmoreland Ridges (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 10 at 12:17PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: .Warm, moist air will continue to spread north across a stalled frontal zone extending from the Laurel Highlands into northern and central West Virginia. This boundary will be the focus for numerous showers and thunderstorms this afternoon and evening, which will have the potential to produce very heavy rainfall. With these same areas having received localized heavy rainfall on Saturday, conditions are favorable for flash flooding, particularly over the higher terrain. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall is possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Pennsylvania, including the following areas, Higher Elevations of Fayette and Higher Elevations of Westmoreland. Portions of northern West Virginia, including the following areas, Eastern Preston, Eastern Tucker, Marion, Monongalia, Preston, Ridges of Eastern Monongalia and Northwestern Preston and Western Tucker. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected this afternoon and evening across the watch area. These will be slow-moving and capable of producing very heavy rainfall, which may result in flash flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
